title: subworkflow - dynatrace check if davis problem is solved or closed
description:
Subworkflow to Check if a Davis Problem is Solved or Closed

Use Case:
When executing multiple remediation steps in a workflow, this subworkflow can be used to validate whether a specific 
step has resolved the problem. If the problem is still open, the subworkflow will fail.

You can configure the "retry on error" setting in the parent workflow to retry this subworkflow for a specific durationfor example,
run for 10 minutes and check periodically if the problem has been resolved.

If the problem is not resolved within the defined time window, you can:

* Add another remediation step.
* Escalate the issue to a human operator.

This approach enables automated, iterative problem resolution while maintaining control over escalation and fallback strategies.

Parameters:

dynatrace_problem_display_id: (Reguired) Davis Problem id (for example P-25051158)

check-if-problem-solved.name: check-if-problem-solved

input.query:
fetch events, from: now()-7d
| filter matchesPhrase(display_id,"{{input()["dynatrace_problem_display_id"] }}" ) and matchesValue(event.status_transition, "RESOLVED" ) or matchesPhrase(display_id,"{{input()["dynatrace_problem_display_id"] }}" ) and matchesValue(event.status_transition, "CLOSED" )

check-if-problem-solved.description: Make use of Dynatrace Grail data in your workflow.
